extends Object
implements AutoCloseable, Serializable

    • Method Detail

      • getString

        public CompletableFuture<String> getString(String id)
        Retrieves a given ID from the storage stored using putString(String, String) or put(String, byte[]) as a String.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID to retrieve from the storage.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to the String version of the stored value for this ID or null if it does not exist.

      • removeString

        public CompletableFuture<String> removeString(String id)
        Removes a given ID from the storage stored using putString(String, String) or put(String, byte[]) as a String.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID to remove from the storage.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to the String version of the stored value for this ID or null if it does not exist.

      • putString

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> putString(String id,
                                            String value)
        Store a given ID and String value for that ID into the storage.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID to represent this entry.
        value - The String value to store for this entry.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true or false if the storage was successful.

      • getAllString

        public CompletableFuture<Map<String,String>> getAllString()
        Retrieves all the IDs stored with putString(String, String) or put(String, byte[]) or putObject(String, Serializable) from the storage as Strings.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to a Map of IDs to their stored values as Strings or null if no data is present.

      • removeObject

        public <U extends Serializable> CompletableFuture<U> removeObject(String id)
        Retrieves and removes data stored for a given String identifier as a Serializable object.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the Serializable object.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the data.
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture that resolves to the data, null if no data, or completes exceptionally.

      • putObject

        public <U extends Serializable> CompletableFuture<Boolean> putObject(String id,
                                                                     U data)
        Stores any Serializable object for a given String identifier.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the Serializable object.
        Parameters:
        id - The id to store this data under.
        data - The object to store as the data.
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture that resolves to true the store succeeded or false if not.

      • getObject

        public <U extends Serializable> CompletableFuture<U> getObject(String id)
        Retrieves data stored for a given String identifier as a Serializable object.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the Serializable object.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the data.
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture that resolves to the data, null if no data, or completes exceptionally.

      • get

        public abstract CompletableFuture<byte[]> get(String id)
        Retrieves a given ID from the storage stored using put(String, byte[]).
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID to retrieve from the storage.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to the stored value for this ID or null if it does not exist as a byte[]. It completes exceptionally if there were issues.

      • remove

        public abstract CompletableFuture<byte[]> remove(String id)
        Removes a given ID from the storage stored using put(String, byte[]).
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID to remove from the storage.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to the stored value for this ID or null if it does not exist as a byte[]. It completes exceptionally if there were issues.

      • put

        public abstract CompletableFuture<Boolean> put(String id,
                                               byte[] value)
        Store a given ID and value for that ID into the storage.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID to represent this entry.
        value - The value to store for this entry.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true if the storage was successful.

      • putAll

        public abstract CompletableFuture<Boolean> putAll(Map<String,byte[]> data)
        Stores a map of IDs and values into the storage.
        Parameters:
        data - The map of IDs and values to store.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true if the storage was completely successful.

      • getAll

        public abstract CompletableFuture<Map<String,byte[]>> getAll()
        Retrieves all the IDs stored with putString(String, String) or put(String, byte[]) or putObject(String, Serializable) from the storage as byte[].
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to a Map of IDs to their stored values as byte[] or null if no data is present. It completes exceptionally if there were issues.

      • clear

        public abstract CompletableFuture<Boolean> clear()
        Removes all the IDs stored with putString(String, String) or put(String, byte[]) or putObject(String, Serializable) from the storage as byte[].
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true or false if the wipe was successful.

      • clear

        public abstract CompletableFuture<Boolean> clear(Set<String> ids)
        Removes a given set of IDs from the storage.
        Parameters:
        ids - The set of IDs to remove from the storage.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true if the wipe was successful and throws otherwise.

      • close

        public void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • from

        public static StorageManager from(BulletConfig config)
        Create a StorageManager instance using the class specified in the config file.
        Parameters:
        config - The non-null BulletConfig containing the class name and StorageManager settings.
        Returns:
        an instance of specified class initialized with settings from the input file and defaults.
